etymologies: late 16th century: from Latin seselis, from Greek. The spelling change was due to association with the given name Cicely

definitions: an aromatic white-flowered plant of the parsley family, with fernlike leaves.

notes.text: Genera Myrrhis and Osmorhiza, family Umbelliferae: several species, in particular the European M. odorata, grown as a pot herb and used in herbal medicine, and the North American O. claytoni

shortDefinitions: aromatic white-flowered plant of parsley family
